question: Are metadata updates automated from source systems?
Are data schemas and attributes documented and accessible?
Is business context attached to key data elements (e.g., KPI definitions)?
Is there a common glossary of business terms used across departments?
Is the glossary integrated with data catalog or BI tools?
Are field names, types, formats, and constraints consistently documented?
Can users easily search for data assets across systems using keywords or metadata?
Are filters available to refine searches by data type, owner, classification, or system?
Is end-to-end lineage captured from source to consumption layer?
Are security and privacy rules applied during automated discovery?
Are profiling results stored and viewable within the data catalog?
Is there a review/comment system to provide feedback on data sets?
Are there predefined tag categories (e.g., domain, sensitivity, use case)?
Are annotations linked to lineage or quality insights?
Is there a platform or workspace for users to share data usage best practices?
Is the search engine context-aware (understands synonyms, business terms, and intent)?
Is there a centralized business ontology that maps terms, definitions, and relationships?
Does the platform use ML models to improve data search relevance over time?
Are taxonomies (e.g., data domains, categories, hierarchies) standardized and maintained?
Are all key data sources (databases, data lakes, BI tools, APIs) included in metadata scans?
Is metadata ingestion automated and scheduled regularly?
Is technical metadata (e.g., schemas, data types, primary/foreign keys) captured accurately?
Are there native connectors available for common platforms (e.g., Snowflake, SAP, Tableau)?
